SPARCED

Model Creation¶

create_model.create_model()[source]¶

Generate Antimony, SBML and AMICI models based on given input data

Parameters:

  • f_observables ([str]) – path to the observables file

  • model_name ([str]) – desired name for the generated Antimony, SBML and AMICI models

  • f_compartments ([str]) – path to the compartments & volumes file

  • f_stoichmatrix ([str]) – path to the stoichiometric matrix file

  • f_output_dir_path ([str]) – path to the desired output directory

  • f_output_parameters ([str]) – path to the output parameters file

  • f_ratelaws – path to the ratelaws file

  • f_ratelaws – [str]

  • f_species ([str]) – path to the species file

  • verbose ([bool]) – verbose

  • is_SPARCED ([bool]) – activate hard-coded behaviors for SPARCED

Returns:

Nothing TODO change this

Return type:

[void]

Utilities¶

General¶

arguments.parse_args()[source]¶

Retrieve and parse arguments necessary for model creation :return: a namespace populated with all the attributes :rtype: [Namespace]

Antimony¶

Model writing

model_writing.antimony_write_model()[source]¶

Generate an Antimony file based on given data :param model_name: name for the generated antimony model :type model_name: [str] :param f_compartments: compartments & volumes file :type f_compartments: [str] :param f_stoichmat: stoichiometric matrix file :type f_stoichmat: [str] :param f_output_params: output parameters file :type f_output_params: [str] :param f_ratelaws: ratelaws file :type f_ratelaws: [str] :param f_species: species file :param is_SPARCED: activate hard-coded behaviors of SPARCED !type is_SPARCED: [bool] :type f_species: [str] :return: The file name of the generated Antimony model + compartments and species :rtype: ([str], list[str], list[str])

Utilities

antimony_utils.antimony_init()[source]¶

Load compartments, volumes and species from data files

Parameters:

  • f_cv ([str]) – name of the compartments & volumes file

  • f_s ([str]) – name of the species file

Returns:

A tuple of the compartments, volumes and species lists

Return type:

(list[str],list[str],list[str])

f ([open (w) file]) – the Antimony file to write in

Returns:

None

antimony_utils.antimony_write_init_compartments()[source]¶

Write compartments initial conditions in the given Antimony file

Parameters:

  • f – name of the Antimony file to write in as an open (w) file

  • comp (([str])) – the compartments names

  • vol (([numericals])) – the compartments volumes

Returns:

None

Return type:

[void]

antimony_utils.antimony_write_init_reactions()[source]¶

Write reactions’ parameters’ initial conditions in the given Antimony file

Parameters:

  • f – the Antimony file to write in as an open (w) file

  • p_names (([string])) – the parameters names

  • p_vals (([numericals])) – the parameters values

Returns:

None

Return type:

[void]

antimony_utils.antimony_write_init_species()[source]¶

Write species’ initial concentrations in the given Antimony file

Parameters:

  • f – the Antimony file to write in as an open (w) file

  • spec – the species’ names and concentrations as a Numpy array

Returns:

None.

antimony_utils.antimony_write_reactions()[source]¶

Write reactions in the given Antimony file WARNING: This function contains a massive copy/paste from some older code

Parameters:

  • f – the Antimony file to write in as an open (w) file

  • f_rl – the name of the ratelaws file as a string

  • f_sm – the name of the stoichiometric matrix file as a string

  • f_outp – the name of the output parameters file as a string

Returns:

A typle with the parameters’ names list and the parameters’ values list.

antimony_utils.antimony_write_species()[source]¶

Write species’ names and compartments in the given Antimony file

Parameters:

  • f – the Antimony file to write in as an open (w) file

  • spec – the species’ names and concentrations as a list of Numpy array

Returns:

None.
